episodes.title: Mike Rigby
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: On this podcast Debbie talks to Mike Rigby about his international  career in design and branding and how to stay creatively engaged.

episodes.title: Design Matters from the Archive: Su Mathews Hale
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Debbie talks to Su Matthews Hale about her efforts to bring more attention to female designers

episodes.title: Sam Winston
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: On this episode Debbie talks to artist + writer Sam Winston about his life-long fascination with type.

episodes.title: Nicholas Blechman
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: On this podcast Debbie talks to Nicholas Blechman about the importance of political satire.

episodes.title: Seth Godin
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Debbie talks to Seth Godin about how to live in our difficult political moment.

episodes.title: Anil Dash
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Debbie Millman talks to Anil Dash about politics, technology and culture.

episodes.title: Brian Koppelman
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Debbie talks to Brian Koppelman about why he became a writer after years as a record promoter and producer.

episodes.title: Design Matters: Best Of 2016
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Debbie highlights some of her favorite conversations of 2016, including Alison Bechdel, Alain de Botton, Lisa Congdon, Chris Anderson, Krista Tippet, Eileen Myles, and Amanda Palmer.

episodes.title: Adam J. Kurtz
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Debbie talks to Adam J. Kurtz about designing for psychological health. “I’m not going to change your life, I’m just going to share with you the tools that are helping me.”

episodes.title: Gail Bichler
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Debbie talks to New York Times Magazine design director Gail Bichler about magazine design and the role of the magazine cover in the digital age.

episodes.title: Cindy Gallop
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Debbie talks to Cindy Gallop about her career in advertising and about the trouble people have communicating about sex.

episodes.title: Tim Ferriss
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Debbie talks to writer Tim Ferriss about the strategies he has used to change his life.

episodes.title: Eileen Myles
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Debbie talks to poet Eileen Myles about poetry, fame, and politics.

episodes.title: Keira Alexandra
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Debbie talks to designer Keira Alexandra about what to do when you need extras for a video shoot.

episodes.title: Pierluigi Serraino
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Debbie talks to architect Pierluigi Serraino about some of the things creative people have in common.

episodes.title: Grace Bonney
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Debbie talks to Design*Sponge founder Grace Bonney about her new book on women entrepreneurs and makers and about the necessity and difficulty of change.

episodes.title: Steven Watson
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Debbie talks to Stack Magazines founder Steven Watson about the passion behind the independent magazines that he loves.

episodes.title: Bonnie Siegler
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Debbie talks to designer Bonnie Siegler about her career and about the conflict between designers and their clients.

episodes.title: Lana Z Porter
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Debbie talks to designer, writer, and researcher Lana Z. Porter about branding for millennials + more.

episodes.title: Giorgia Lupi
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Debbie talks to information designer Giorgia Lupi about data visualization and the data of our personal lives.

episodes.title: Joe Hollier
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Debbie talks to Joe Hollier about an invention of his that is designed to bring back boredom in the era of the smartphone.

episodes.title: Kelli Anderson
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Debbie talks to artist and designer Kelli Anderson about her new pop-up book, This Book is a Planetarium, and about her collaboration with They Might Be Giants.

episodes.title: Design Matters from the Archive: Tobias Frere-Jones
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Debbie talks to type designer Tobias Frere-Jones about his career and why typefaces are like the air we breathe.

episodes.title: Design Matters from the Archive: Maira Kalman
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Debbie talks to writer and illustrator Maira Kalman about how ordinary objects inspire her art, and about her collaborations with the likes of Mark Morris and Isaac Mizrahi.

episodes.title: Design Matters from the Archive: Maria Konnikova
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Debbie talks to psychology writer Maria Konnikova about her career and her fascination with con artists. She explains why so many people fall prey to confidence games.

episodes.title: Design Matters from the Archive: Maria Konnikova
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Debbie talks to psychology writer Maria Konnikova about her career and her fascination with con artists. She explains why so many people fall prey to confidence games.

episodes.title: Design Matters from the Archive: Eli Horowitz
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Debbie talks to editor and digital novelist Eli Horowitz about the virtues of collaboration + more

episodes.title: Design Matters from the Archive: Roz Chast
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Debbie talks to Roz Chast about how she earned a coveted spot as a cartoonist for The New Yorker magazine, and how her art is informed by the brutal reality of life.

episodes.title: Design Matters from the Archive: Timothy Goodman
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Debbie talks to Timothy Goodman about how, after barely getting through high school, he went on to a very visible career that he is still in the process of defining.

episodes.title: Design Matters from the Archive: Tiffany Shlain
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: On this episode, Debbie talks to Tiffany Shlain about her films, about starting the Webby Awards, and about the growing presence of technology in our lives.

episodes.title: Design Matters from the Archive: Brandon Stanton
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Debbie talks to photographer Brandon Stanton about his ongoing project “Humans of New York” and why total strangers open up to him.

episodes.title: Gretchen Rubin
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Debbie talks to author Gretchen Rubin about happiness and the power of habit.

episodes.title: Alain de Botton
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Debbie talks to Alain de Botton about  love and sex.

episodes.title: Chris Anderson
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Debbie talks to Chris Anderson about how the TED conference has helped changed the way we learn.

episodes.title: Design Matters from the Archive: Isaac Mizrahi
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Debbie talks to Isaac Mizrahi about why he loves fashion and why he does so many things outside of fashion.

episodes.title: Design Matters from the Archive: Julia Turshen
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Debbie talks to Julia about cooking and writing, and how to peel a hard-boiled egg.

episodes.title: Design Matters from the Archive: Ben Schott
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Debbie talks to Ben Schott about the importance of failing early in one’s career, about how to take a politician’s picture, and about writing and designing his own books.

episodes.title: Lisa Congdon
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: On this episode Debbie talks with artist and writer Lisa Congdon about how she sometimes felt like an imposter.

episodes.title: Steven Heller
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: On their annual podcast Debbie talks to graphic design guru Steve about how to deliver social critiques with a punch.

episodes.title: Alison Bechdel
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Debbie talks to Alicon Bechdel about how identifying herself as a lesbian when she was young lead her into a career as a cartoonist.

episodes.title: Nico Muhly
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Debbie talks to composer Nico Muhly about his music and about the musicians who interpret it.

episodes.title: Todd Waterbury
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Debbie Millman talks to Target’s Chief Creative Officer Todd Waterbury about how technology is changing consumption and about how smart phones have raised our expectations for how companies should interact with us.

episodes.title: Caroline Paul
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Debbie talks to writer Caroline Paul about her death-defying adventures, and how girls must learn the difference between fear and exhilaration.

episodes.title: Amanda Palmer
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Debbie talks to Amanda about her wild and wandering path to the rock stage, and about how behind her artistic ambitions is the drive to feel real.

episodes.title: Krista Tippett
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Debbie talks with radio host Krista Tippett about her religious orientation, her struggle with depression, and about why it’s so hard to understand our historical moment.

episodes.title: Greg Hahn + Ryan Moore
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Debbie talks to branding designers Greg Hahn and Ryan Moore about their process when working with clients such as Netflix and MoMA.

episodes.title: Kate Bolick
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Debbie Millman talks with writer Kate Bolick about society’s historically skeptical view of a single woman.

episodes.title: Mimi Váldes
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Debbie talks to Mimi Valdés about her unstoppable career, from magazine editor to her creative partnership with the pop singer Pharrell Williams.

episodes.title: Ayse Birsel
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Debbie talks to Ayse Birsel about her expansive career as an industrial designer and how she uses art and design to reconstruct her personal and professional life around a core idea.

episodes.title: Eric Zimmer
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Debbie talks to Eric Zimmer about the twists and turns in his surprising career as a tech entrepreneur, and abot some of the things he’s learned along the way.

episodes.title: Tucker Nichols
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Debbie talks to artist Tucker Nichols about his art, and the quality of the art he loves.

episodes.title: Doug Powell
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: On this episode Debbie talks to Doung Powell about how designers can use their skills beyond the confines of the profession.

episodes.title: Scott Clemons
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Debbie talks to Scott Clemons about one of the great printers and designers of all time.

episodes.title: Simon Sinek
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Debbie Millman talks to author Simon Sinek about the fruits of good leadership.

episodes.title: Robin Petravic + Catherine Bailey
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Debbie talks with Robin Petravic and Catherine Bailey about running Heath Ceramics.

episodes.title: Michael Bierut
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Debbie talks to Design Observer co-founder Michael Bierut about why he thinks graphic design is so cool.

episodes.title: Jonathan Fields
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Author and entrepreneur Jonathan Fields on his previous careers as a lawyer and personal trainer, and on The Good Life. "The Good Life is not a place at which you arrive, it’s a lens through which you see and create."

episodes.title: Design Matters From the Archive: Clement Mok
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Debbie talks to designer Clement Mok about the early days of Apple computer, the heady days of the software bubble, and the joys of working for Steve Jobs.

episodes.title: Design Matters From the Archive: Bob Gill
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Debbie talks to legendary designer Bob Gill about coming up in the profession in the 1950s, about working with the Beatles, and the problem with many designers today.

episodes.title: Design Matters from the Archive: Michael Donovan + Nancye Green
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Michael Donovan + Nancye Green on their partnership in marriage and design.

episodes.title: Design Matters From the Archive: Michael Arad
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: The designer of the 9/11 memorial—Michael Arad— on the process of design.

episodes.title: Design Matters From the Archive: Chip Kidd
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Debbie talks to book designer Chip Kidd about why his TED talk turned into the most terrifying 19 minutes of his life, and about his book of graphic design for children.

episodes.title: Design Matters From The Archive: Marion Deuchars
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Debbie talks to illustrator and author Marion Deuchars about the expressiveness of hand-lettering, about how drawing is an intense form of looking, and the limited value of technology in teaching art to children.

episodes.title: Design Matters From the Archive: Louise Fili
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Debbie talks to Louise Fili about designing book covers, designing for restaurants, about why she prefers working for small businesses, and about the importance of sketching.

episodes.title: Design Matters From The Archive: Massimo Vignelli
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Debbie talks to Massimo Vignelli about his favorite typeface, his fight against vulgarity in his design, and what he means by forceful design.

episodes.title: Design Matters from the Archive: Peter Mendelsund
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Debbie talks to Peter Mendelsund about what makes a great book cover, rebranding the classics, and about his fears of the iPad and Kindle.

episodes.title: Design Matters From The Archive: Caroline Paul + Wendy MacNaughton
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Debbie talks to illustrator Wendy MacNaughton and author Caroline Paul about their unusually intimate collaboration on a book.

episodes.title: Design Matters from the Archive: Brian Rea
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Debbie talks to Brian Rea about the value of being rejected, about art directing for the New York Times, and about his development as an illustrator.

episodes.title: Design Matters From The Archive: Rob Walker
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Debbie talks to Rob Walker about the Sunggie and his fantasy branding project.

episodes.title: Design Matters From The Archive: Marian Bantjes
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Debbie talks to Marian Bantjes about her daring typography and her highly ornamental designs.

episodes.title: Kelli Anderson
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Debbie talks to Kelli Anderson about what design can tell us about the world.

episodes.title: Design Matters From the Archive: Tina Roth Eisenberg
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Debbie talks to SwissMiss — aka Tina Roth Eisenberg — discusses her blog, CreativeMornings, and the beauty found in ordinary things.

episodes.title: Design Matters From The Archive: James Victore
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Debbie Millman and James Victore discusses his book, putting his opinion in the work and the difference between God-jobs and money jobs.

episodes.title: Oliver Jeffers
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Debbie talks to artist and illustrator Oliver Jeffers, who explains how illustrating and writing children’s books has changed his fine art painting.

episodes.title: Carolina Rogoll
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Branding expert Carolina Rogoll talks about how to update a brand and why sabbaticals are a good idea.

episodes.title: Audrey Arbeeny
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Recorded live at "What Design Sounds Like," Debbie talks to Audrey Arbeeny about audio branding.

episodes.title: Virginia Postrel
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Debbie Millman talks to Virginia Postrel about the power of glamorous objects and glamorous people.

episodes.title: Elle Luna
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Debbie Millman talks to Elle Luna about why she walked away from great design jobs with IDEO, Uber, and Mailbox.

episodes.title: Ron Burrage
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Debbie Millman talks to Ron Burrage about his design career, his performance career, and about how to design fearlessly.

episodes.title: Julia Turshen
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: On this episode of Design Matters, Debbie Millman talks to Julia Turshen about cooking and writing (and how to successfully peel a hard boiled egg).

episodes.title: Steven Heller
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: On this episode of Design Matters, Debbie Millman talks to Steven Heller about his new book Graphic Style Lab.

episodes.title: Lynda Weinman
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: On this episode of Design Matters, Debbie talks to lynda.com’s Lynda Weinman about how the internet is challenging the traditional classroom model.

episodes.title: Morley
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: On this episode of Design Matters Debbie Millman talks to Morley about her songs of social change.

episodes.title: Ben Watson
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: On this episode Debbie Millman talks to Herman Miller’s Ben Watson about how design affects people who never even think about design.

episodes.title: Louise Sandhaus
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: On this episode of Design Matters, Debbie Millman speaks with Louise Sandhaus about her macrobiotic past, her new book, and her struggles to get it published.

episodes.title: Jessica Walsh + Timothy Goodman
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: On this week’s episode Debbie Millman talks to Jessica Walsh and Timothy Goodman about their unusual collaboration

episodes.title: Isaac Mizrahi
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: To launch the 10th season of Design Matters, Debbie Millman talks to Isaac Mizrahi about why he loves fashion and why he does so many things outside of fashion.

episodes.title: Chee Pearlman
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: On this episode of Design Matters, Debbie Millman talks to editor, curator, and design fairy godmother Chee Pearlman about editing a design magazine and designing conferences.

episodes.title: Liz Danzico
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: On this episode of Design Matters, Debbie Millman talks to Liz Danzico about writing and designing, life in NYC, and why it’s so important to keep learning (and re-learning).

episodes.title: Justin Ahrens
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: On this episode of Design Matters, Debbie Millman talks to Justin Ahrens about designing for social change and his book.

episodes.title: Ji Lee
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: On this episode of Design Matters with Debbie Millman, Debbie talks with designer Ji Lee about why he hates most advertising, but why he loves the idea of advertising on Facebook (where he works).

episodes.title: Emily Spivack
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: On this episode of Design Matters, Debbie Millman talks to writer and curator Emily Spivack about how our clothes are more than fabric and thread.

episodes.title: Moira Cullen
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: On this episode of Design Matters Debbie Millman talks to Moira Cullen—design strategist, writer and educator—about her innovative design work for some of the world’s leading brands.

episodes.title: Tina + Ryan Essmaker
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: On this episode of Design Matters Debbie Millman talks to Tina and Ryan Essmaker, designers, photographers, creative directors and cofounders of The Great Discontent

episodes.title: Caroline Baumann
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: On this episode of Design Matters, Debbie Millman talks to Cooper Hewitt director Caroline Baumann about her career in museums and why the interest in design has surged in recent years.

episodes.title: Fritz Karch
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: On this episode of Design Matters, Debbie Millman talks to Fritz Karch on being a stylist for Martha Stewart, owning an antique shop, and what it means to be a collector.

episodes.title: Ben Schott
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: On this episode of Design Matters, Debbie Millman talks to Ben Schott about the importance of failing early in one’s career, about how to take a politician’s picture, and about writing and designing his own books.

episodes.title: Petter Ringbom
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: On this episode of Design Matters, Debbie Millman talks to Petter Ringbom about his years at the creative agency Flat, and how he moved away from graphic design into filmmaking.

episodes.title: Tom Geismar
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: In this episode of Design Matters, Debbie Millman talks to legendary designer Tom Geismar about how the practice of design has changed since the 1950s.

episodes.title: Noah Brier
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Noah Brier on brands, design and content in the age of social media.

episodes.title: Dani Shapiro
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: On this episode of Design Matters with Debbie Millman, Debbie talks to writer Dani Shapiro about being raised an Orthodox Jew, about being vulnerable in her work, and about writing her way out of an existential crisis.

episodes.title: Brian Singer
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: On this episode of Design Matters with Debbie Millman, Debbie talks to Brian Singer, Communication Design team leader at Facebook,.

episodes.title: Steven Heller
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Steven Heller talks about graphic design before it was called graphic design, and about whether design magazines have a future in print.

episodes.title: Rachel Sussman
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Artist Rachel Sussman discusses her new book and explains what it was like to be abandoned without supplies — or a phone — in Greenland.

episodes.title: Scott Lerman
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Scott Lerman talks about his new step-by-step book about brand strategy and about how consumer research can limit innovative thinking.

episodes.title: Maria Giudice
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Maria Giudice talks with Debbie Milliman about the early days of design on the internet, and what it's like to work for Facebook.

episodes.title: Michael Donovan + Nancye Green
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Debbie talks to Michael Donovan + Nancye Green about their life and work partnership and how good business is good design.

episodes.title: Debra Bishop
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Design Director of More Magazine, Debra Bishop discusses her career designing for magazines, including her years working for Martha Stewart, and the tension between designers and editors.

episodes.title: Joe Marianek
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Joe Marianek talks about decisions that shaped his career and about the process of getting hired at Apple.

episodes.title: Jonathan Harris
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Jonathan Harris on his web and database art projects, his relationship to time and memory, and the sexuality of the internet.

episodes.title: Dana Arnett
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: VSA's Dana  Arnett on getting kicked out of design school and making the  transition from designer to CEO.

episodes.title: Irma Boom
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Debbie Millman talks to Irma Boom  about the art and craft of her celebrated book designs.

episodes.title: Amanda Michel + Amy Webb
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Debbie Millman talks to Spark Camp founders Amanda Michel  + Amy Webb about redesigning the traditional conference and its lasting  effect on participants.

episodes.title: Bob Gill
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Legendary designer Bob Gill talks about design in the  1950s, working with the Beatles and the problem with so many designers  today.

episodes.title: Matteo Bologna
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: On this episode of Design Matters with Debbie Millman, Debbie talks to Matteo Bologna about his early years in Italy, his addiction to typography and the question of self-confidence.

episodes.title: Alex Center
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Lead designer for CocaCola's Vitaminwater and Powerade Alex Center talks about his love of brands.

episodes.title: Susan Szenasy
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Susan S. Szenasy is editor-in-chief of METROPOLIS, the award-winning New York City-based magazine of architecture and design.

episodes.title: Terry Teachout
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Terry Teachout discusses the early days of blogging, the poetics of theater and what it's like to be a drama critic for The Wall Street Journal.

episodes.title: Dawn Hancock
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Firebelly Design founder Dawn Hancock discusses what it means to be a  socially conscious designer.

episodes.title: Jennifer Kinon + Bobby Martin
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: OCD Designers Jennifer Kinon + Bobby Martin talk about their design philosophy — and their general willingness to do the unexpected.

episodes.title: Oded Ezer
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Typographer Oded  Ezer talks about the idea of a universal language — and how his limitations as a musican and poet led to his  extraordinary typography.

episodes.title: Sheila Bridges
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Debbie Millman talks to  interior designer Sheila Bridges about being one of the only prominent  African Americans in her industry, about losing her hair and having Bill Clinton  as a client.

episodes.title: Chip Kidd
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Legendary book designer Chip Kidd on why his TED talk was the 19 most frightening minutes of his life.

episodes.title: Hartmut Esslinger
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Frog design co-founder Hartmut Esslinger talks about working for Steve Jobs  in the early days of Apple.

episodes.title: Interaction of Color
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Brenda Danilowitz, Chief Curator at the Josef and Anni Albers Foundation and Potion principal Philip Tiongson discuss the new Interaction of Color app.

episodes.title: Jean-Louis Cohen
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Jean-Louis Cohen reveals a Le Corbusier who was not only a great architect, but also a savvy promoter of his own ideas and work.

episodes.title: Michael Rock
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Michael Rock about self-hatred in design, the benefits  of being an outsider, and his new book.

episodes.title: Maggie Macnab
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Designer, educator and author Maggie Macnab talks about what designers can learn from nature — and what they can give back.

episodes.title: Jessica Walsh
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Jessica Walsh once sold moss-covered rocks to her elementary school classmates. Today, she's Stefan Sagmeister's partner in Sagmeister + Walsh.

episodes.title: Ben Chestnut + Aarron Walter
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Mailchimp CEO Ben Chestnut and User Expereince Lead Aaron Walter talk how they got where they are — and where Freddie the  monkey came from.

episodes.title: Wendy MacNaughton + Caroline Paul
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Wendy  MacNaughton and Caroline Paul on a journey from advertising to Rwanda to illustration, and from Stanford to firefighter to author.

episodes.title: Emily Oberman
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Emily Oberman's three acts — from Tibor Kalman at M&Co, to Number Seventeen with Bonnie Siegler, to becoming a partner at Pentagram.

episodes.title: Jennifer Sterling
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Jennifer Sterling on her process, how money should be designed, and the way  teaching has influenced her career.

episodes.title: Amy Webb
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Digital strategist and author Amy Webb on how she  gamed online dating to find her husband.

episodes.title: Cliff Sloan
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: On this episode of Design Matters, Debbie Millman interviews Cliff Sloan about everything marketing.

episodes.title: Sara Blake
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Debbie Millman talks to Sara Blake  about collaborating with her  sister, creating portraits of 100 girls and illustrating NBA players.

episodes.title: Steven Heller
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Steven Heller discusses his new ebook, Design Cult, and reflects on what designers have in common with Harvey Weinstein.

episodes.title: Clement Mok
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Clement Mok  on the early days of Apple computer, the joys of  working for Steve Jobs and starting his successful businesses.

episodes.title: Roberto de Vicq de Cumptich
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Roberto de Vicq de Cumptich  discusses growing up in Brazi, the role of art versus design, and why it is so important to be witty.

episodes.title: Sophie Blackall
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Sophie Blackall discusses learning to draw, painting vs. illustration and her favorite postings from Craigslist.

episodes.title: Jen Bilik
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Jen Bilik on being a certified entrepreneurial badass: she's the founder of the company Knock Knock.

episodes.title: Marion Deuchars
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Marion Deuchars on the expressiveness of hand lettering, how drawing is an intensive form  of looking, and the need to be messy when creating art.

episodes.title: Jason Kottke
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: In this audio interview with Debbie Millman, Jason Kottke talks about blogging for over fourteen years and what it means to be "old" online.

episodes.title: Christopher Simmons
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Christopher Simmons discusses his lastest book, Just Design: Socially Conscious Design for Critical Causes, and reflects on why designers should be continually redefining their profession.

episodes.title: Jake Barton
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: In this audio interview with Debbie Millman, Jake Barton discusses  wanting to be a doctor, how he became a media designer and how to get people to interact.

episodes.title: Louise Fili
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Louise Fili discusses the importance of sketching, her obsession with typography and why she prefers working with small organizations.

episodes.title: Rafael Esquer
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Rafael Esquer discusses growing up on a farm, working with the city and what it takes to make it in the  design business.

episodes.title: Mirko Ilic
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Bosnian-born designer  and illustrator Mirko Ilic discusses his early career behind  the iron curtain, his prolific drawing and his current career in New York.

episodes.title: Austin McGhie
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Debbie Millman talks to her colleague Austin  McGhie, who explains why brand could be a four letter word.

episodes.title: Aaron Draplin
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: In this audio interview with Debbie Millman, Aaron Draplin talks about  being comfortable in his own skin, midwestern pragmatism and why Oregon  beats the shit out of SoCal.

episodes.title: Scott Stowell
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: In this audio interview with Debbie Millman, Scott Stowell discusses  using color separation in elementary school, interning at M&Co and the importance of language in design.

episodes.title: Chris Ware
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: In this audio interview with Debbie Millman, Chris Ware discusses his  influences – including sending a Valentine to Charlie Brown – and explains why  empathy figures so heavily into his work.

episodes.title: Steven Heller
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Steven Heller discusses the  big ideas that have changed graphic design – including the UPC code,  teen magazines and the pointed finger.

episodes.title: Ken Carbone
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: In this audio interview with Debbie Millman, Ken Carbone discusses  meeting his design heros, his celebrated sketchbooks and journals and  what he really thinks about his relationship with his corporate clients.

episodes.title: Randy J. Hunt
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Etsy creative director Randy J. Hunt discusses working for Milton Glaser, his record label and the challenges of managing a brand as diverse as Etsy.

episodes.title: Khoi Vinh
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Khoi Vinh on his role as design director at NYTimes.com, spending spring break in college setting type and the online relationship between publisher and consumer.

episodes.title: Roman Mars
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Radio producer Roman Mars  discusses the connection between ’zines and radio, why he ditched science and the reason he named his show “99% Invisible”.

episodes.title: John Flansburgh
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: John Flansburgh on being the son of a modernist architect, designing album covers for They Might Be Giants and of course, making music.

episodes.title: Maria Popova
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: In this audio interview with Debbie Millman, Maria Popova discusses growing up in Bulgaria, the evolution of Brainpicker and inventing the curator’s code.

episodes.title: Jen Bekman
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Jen Bekman discusses  managing a BBS in the early days of the internet, her first email  exchange and the importance of  everyone owning art.

episodes.title: Karl Heiselman
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Wolff Olins CEO Karl Heiselman discusses the controversial London 2012 logo, designing the culture of his company and the relationship between branding and popularity.

episodes.title: James Biber
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: In this audio interview with Debbie Millman, James Biber discusses  growing up in a house with a womb chair, visual illiteracy and  designing the Museum of Sex.

episodes.title: Cheryl Heller
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: In this audio interview with Debbie Millman, Cheryl Heller discusses  innovation, her new MFA program at SVA and why the word ‘brand’ is like leather pants.

episodes.title: Erik Spiekermann
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: In this audio interview with Debbie Millman, Erik Spiekermann discusses  why numbers are harder to design than letters, finding his print shop  burned to the ground and why he's trying to get out of work.

episodes.title: Martin Venezky
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Martin Venezky discusses his journey to becoming one of the design innovators of our time.

episodes.title: Peter Mendelsund
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: In this podcast interview with Debbie Millman, Peter Mendelsund discusses how he became a book designer and his fear of the Kindle and iPad.

episodes.title: Andrew Gibbs
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: In this podcast interview with Debbie Millman, Andrew Gibbs discusses his love of packaging, the role brands play in people's lives and his blog, The Dieline.

episodes.title: Brian Rea
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: In this podcast interview with Debbie Millman, Brian Rea discusses the value of being rejected, art directing for The New York Times and his fascination with UFO’s.

episodes.title: John Hockenberry
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: In this podcast interview with Debbie Millman, John Hockenberry discusses The Takeaway — his morning news show on NPR — Steve Jobs and journalism in the age of social-media.

episodes.title: Jake + Pum Lefebure
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: In this podcast interview with Debbie Millman, Jake and Pum Lefebure of Design Army discuss how they met, the importance of sketching and keeping their firm small.

episodes.title: Margaret Roach
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: In this podcast interview with Debbie Millman, Margaret Roach discusses her career with Martha Stewart and her love of gardening.

episodes.title: Linda Tischler
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: In this podcast interview with Debbie Millman, Linda Tischler discusses failing her New Year’s resolutions, why the word “design” turns off business professionals and her new book.

episodes.title: Dori Tunstall
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: In this podcast interview with Debbie Millman, Dori Tunstall discusses branding through the lens of a Design Anthropologist.

episodes.title: Alex Bogusky + John Bielenberg
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: In this audio interview with Debbie Millman, Alex Bogusky and John  Bielenberg discuss branding, global warming and impact  entrepreneurs.

episodes.title: Jessica Hische
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: In this podcast interview with Debbie Millman, Jessica Hische discusses her attachment to the internet, the differences between being a letterer and a type designer and working for Louise Fili.

episodes.title: Michael Arad
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: In this podcast interview with Debbie Millman, Michael Arad, discusses the World Trade Center Memorial.

episodes.title: Angus Hyland
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: In this podcast interview with Debbie Millman, Angus Hyland discusses the peace sign, Deutsche Bank, and the play button.

episodes.title: Alissa Walker
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Alissa Walker discusses her experience in advertising, her love affair with LA and of course, gelato.

episodes.title: Jennifer Morla
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Jennifer Morla talks about leaving New York for San Francisco, her collaboration with Andy Warhol and the qualities of effective design.

episodes.title: Steve Frykholm
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: After a 40-year career with Herman Miller, Steve Frykholm discusses life inside this iconic, National Design Award-winning furniture company.

episodes.title: Grace Bonney
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: In this podcast interview with Debbie Millman, Grace Bonney discusses being a Phish follower, shaking off the cute and the Design*Sponge scholarship program.

episodes.title: Heather B. Armstrong
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Heather Armstrong on reconciling with her family after writing about them on her blog, taking photos of her dog Chuck and her broken Maytag washing machine.

episodes.title: Dominique Browning
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: In this audio interview with Debbie Millman, Dominique Browning discusses her tenure as Editor in Chief at House & Garden, her recent book, Slow Love, and the effects of love on a stuffed animal.

episodes.title: Jonathan Ford
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Jonathan Ford discusses his eighteen job interviews before being hired by Michael Peters, his belief that a good idea cannot come from a computer and the importance of doing work that is truthful.

episodes.title: Eddie Opara
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: In this episode of Design Matters, Eddie Opara discusses being educated by Jesuits, creating the Brooklyn Museum brand at 2x4 and working at Pentagram.

episodes.title: Alina Wheeler
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Philadelphia-based designer Alina Wheeler discusses branding, strategic imagination and her new book, Brand Atlas, co-authored with Joel Katz.

episodes.title: Gail Anderson
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: In this podcast with Debbie Millman, Gail Anderson discusses making little magazines as a child, working at Rolling Stone for fifteen years and what the next chapter in her life holds.

episodes.title: Kate Betts
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Kate Betts discusses Michelle Obama as a style icon and addresses the inevitable comparisons (and differences) between our current First Lady and the legendary Jackie Kennedy.

episodes.title: Rob Walker
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: In this audio interview with Debbie Millman, Rob Walker discusses how our digital records remain online even after we die, and his desire to brand  the idea of being “happy for what you have”.

episodes.title: James Victore
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: In this podcast interview with Debbie Millman, James Victore discusses his book, putting his opinion in the work and the difference between God-jobs and money jobs.

episodes.title: Alexandra Lange + Jane Thompson
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Alexandra Lange and Jane Thompson discuss the power of imagination, Marimekko, Sir Lady Jane and Benjamin Thompson.

episodes.title: Steven Heller
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Steven Heller talks to Debbie Millman about blogging from the bathroom, working with Patti Smith and Paul Rand's tombstone.

episodes.title: Alexander Isley
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: In this podcast interview with Debbie Millman, Alexander Isley discusses his Mom, learning presentation skills from Tibor Kalman and believing that people are inherently good.

episodes.title: Kate Bingaman-Burt
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: In this podcast interview with Debbie Millman, Kate Bingaman-Burt discusses Obsessive Consumption, the designer as reporter and her commitment to making something everyday.

episodes.title: Marian Bantjes
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: In this podcast interview with Debbie Millman, Marian Bantjes discusses her new book, coded text and causing pain to type purists.

episodes.title: Ralph Caplan
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: In this interview with Debbie Millman, Ralph Caplan discusses the difference between making things right and making things nice, the Civil Rights movement and the responsibility of the designer.

episodes.title: Tina Roth Eisenberg
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: On this episode of Design Matters, SwissMiss — aka Tina Roth Eisenberg — discusses her blog, crowd sourcing and the beauty found in ordinary things.

episodes.title: Bill Moggridge
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: In this podcast with Debbie Millman, Bill Moggridge discusses the future of the laptop, human-centered design and the future of the Cooper-Hewitt National Design Museum.

episodes.title: Eric Baker
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: In this audio interview with Debbie Millman, Eric Baker discusses working with Gordon Parks, living in New York City and working for himself.

episodes.title: Stephen Doyle
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: In this podcast interview with Debbie Millman, Stephen Doyle discusses working for Tibor Kalman, renting his soul to the devil and working with his hands.

episodes.title: Massimo Vignelli
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Vignelli Celebration: Season premiere of Design Matters with Debbie Millman, a podcast interview with Massimo Vignelli.

episodes.title: Stefan Sagmeister
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Stefan Sagmeister discusses a year away from his New York-based design practice, spending personal time in Bali and his new documentary film, Happiness.

episodes.title: Tim Brown
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: In this podcast interview with Debbie Millman, Tim Brown reviews his career at IDEO, explores the impact of design processes (drawing and storytelling) and discusses his new book, Change By Design.

episodes.title: William Drenttel + Julie Lasky
episodes.author: Debbie Millman
episodes.summary: Editorial director of Design Observer William Drenttel and Change Observer editor Julie Lasky discuss the state of online media and reflect on the end of print.
